data.title: Cast & Crew — THE JINKX & DELA HOLIDAY SPECIAL
data.text:
Sweet as pie and sharp as cheddar, the Terminally Delightful BenDeLaCreme is known for combining her background in performing and visual arts with a love of spectacle, glamour, and Saturday morning cartoons. She has dazzled crowds throughout the Americas, Europe, and Australia, premiered four critically acclaimed solo shows Off-Broadway, as well as written, directed, and produced myriad narrative works and variety spectaculars that have played to sold-out audiences for over a decade. BenDeLaCreme’s live performances have received glowing reviews: “Keeping you entertained while making you think about your place in the world is all a part of the BenDeLaCreme experience,” said Forbes and Billboard raves that her work “...soars past entertainment and into the realm of theatrical art.”

BenDeLaCreme has appeared on two seasons of the Emmy Award-winning RuPaul’s Drag Race, her first go-round securing her a spot among the show’s “15 Fan Favorites of All Time.” After being crowned “Miss Congeniality” on Season 6, she returned to compete on the third season of RuPaul’s Drag Race All Stars on VH1 where she garnered more challenge wins than any other competitor in the show’s history, among other series records.

Continuing to break new ground by, and for, drag artists, in 2018 DeLa’s production company, BenDeLaCreme Presents, produced its first national tour with, To Jesus, Thanks for Everything! -Jinkx and DeLa, co-created and co-written by BenDeLaCreme and Jinkx Monsoon. In 2019, the queens hit the road again with a brand new holiday show titled, All I Want for Christmas is Attention. That tour was a sold-out sensation and marked DeLa’s first producer credit for an international tour. BenDeLaCreme is thrilled to add producing and directing her first film to her long list of career achievements.

bendelacreme.com

instagram

twitter

Since winning Season 5 of RuPaul's Drag Race, Jinkx Monsoon has travelled the world performing her original cabaret shows with her music partner, Major Scales. The duo are best known for their highly acclaimed show The Vaudevillians, which enjoyed multiple extensions Off-Broadway and toured to many international festivals.

With original music by Major Scales, Jinkx has released two albums: The Inevitable Album and The Ginger Snapped (available on Apple Music [iTunes] and Spotify). While live performing is her passion, Jinkx is no stranger to film and TV work. Besides her stint in reality TV, she has appeared on the CBS cop drama Blue Bloods, the Netflix original AJ and the Queen, and has voiced characters for such animated shows as Steven Universe, Mighty Magiswords, Bravest Warriors, as well as a few surprises that are yet to come!

Jinkx has been the subject of two documentaries: Drag Becomes Him, and The Queens. She is an award winning stage actress, having won the Gregory Award for her portrayal of Hedwig in Hedwig and the Angry Inch, and most recently, The MAC Award for her show The Ginger Snapped co-written with Major Scales. (Gosh, his name pops up a lot in her bio). You can watch her webshow Cool Mom with comedy partner Nick Sahoyah on the streaming app WOW Presents Plus. Jinkx is extremely proud of her partnership with BenDeLaCreme, having co-written and co-starred in both To Jesus, Thanks for Everything! -Jinkx and DeLa and All I Want for Christmas is Attention. Taking their collaboration to the medium of film is a dream come true for this internationally tolerated actress and chanteuse.

jinkxmonsoon.com

instagram

twitter

To whom ever is reading this hello and thank you for taking the time to do so, you are appreciated! I have spent the last six years in Seattle doing mostly musical theater with companies such as The 5th Avenue Theatre, A Contemporary Theatre, ArtsWest Playhouse, and Can Can Culinary Cabaret, among others. Though, of all the roles I've had the pleasure of bringing to life this one has a special place in my heart because it allowed me to perform again during a time of such uncertainty as an artist and human. The grace and diligent work towards ensuring the work environment was inclusive and safe can not be overlooked and is deserving of praise so three cheers to everyone involved in bringing the joy and spectacle that is the dynamic duo of BenDeLaCreme and Jinkx Monsoon to a world that is in need of love and light. Should our paths never cross I hope your life is positively wonderful my friends, be well.

Instagram

Sann (she/her) is a multi-hyphenated art maker based in Seattle, WA. Beginning her career as an actor, she trained at the British American Drama Academy of London and Mount Holyoke College. Now she finds her artistic fulfillment through directing plays and puppet films, puppeteering, puppet building, scenic designing, and collaborating with other artists in an endless variety of creative capacities.

In addition to these artistic pursuits, she is also privileged to work in the business of art as the Production Manager of Seattle Repertory Theater and as the Co-Managing Partner of Pony World Theatre.

PLEASE SUPPORT YOUR LOCAL ARTISTS, NOW AND ALWAYS.

ponyworld.org

seattlerep.org

Chloe Albin is a dancer, choreographer, and educator based in Seattle. The allure of the stage captured her heart at a young age; after years of training, she continued her dance education at Chapman University ('15).

She has been a company member of Wade Madsen and Dancers since 2016, most recently performing in Looking Back at Itself and "Between Knowing and Believing". Other recent works include Café Nordo's Alien/Angel (choreographed by Waxie Moon), and Cameo Lethem's Janus.

Since 2017, this tall powerhouse has captivated audiences as Mrs. Crachick in BenDeLaCreme's Beware the Terror of Gaylord Manor, and has performed across the country with Jinkx Monsoon and BenDeLaCreme in To Jesus, Thanks for Everything and All I Want for Christmas is Attention. It is an honor and delight for her to step into The Jinkx and DeLa Holiday Special as Dance Director, as well as a dancer in the company.

instagram

Cameron Birts is a Freelance Dancer/Artist based in Seattle, WA. He first began dancing at the age of 5 years old when he lived in Roswell, Ga. Upon graduating high school, Cameron went on to study Dance at the University of the Arts in Philadelphia, PA where he also received his B.F.A in Dance. After graduation in 2017, Cameron was offered a contract to be a dancer/artist in Whim W'Him, a Seattle based contemporary dance company under the direction of Olivier Weavers. He performed alongside the company from 2017-2020 where he had the opportunity to work with various choreographers from around the world and perform in premiere works set on the company. Cameron is honored and grateful to have worked with the incredibly talented cast and crew of the The Jinkx and DeLa Holiday Special and for journey as a Freelance Dancer/Artist.

instagram

The Them Fatale of Burlesque, Moscato Extatique is a latinx, non-binary classically trained dancer, educator, and award winning choreographer based out of Seattle, WA where they earned a BFA in Dance from Cornish College of the Arts. This tempting tart is one fourth of world renowned burlesque sensation and Burlesque Hall of Fame’s 2019 Best Large Group, Mod Carousel.

Moscato was crowned The 2020 Duchess of Burlesque at The Noire Pageant in NYC. They were the first AMAB, non-binary performer to compete in the Best Debut category at the Burlesque Hall of Fame Tournament of Tease and was also accepted to compete in the Miss Exotic World category in 2020. Moscato continues to make ripples in the burlesque community by sharing their gender-queer, sexually alluring style with festivals and productions across the US, Canada, and Europe.

MoscatoExtatique.com

Instagram

Facebook

Brian Benson began his career as an assistant director and line producer working on music videos (Metallica, Sixpence None the Richer) and independent films (Groove, Bartleby, Wildflowers). In 2000 he produced his first feature film, Haiku Tunnel, which was selected for the 2001 Sundance Film Festival where it was acquired by Sony Pictures Classics for distribution. Due to his success with Haiku Tunnel and his promise as a producer, Brian received the prestigious Sundance Producer's Fellowship in 2002, where he was mentored by luminaries of the independent film industry: Ted Hope, Ron Yerxa and Scott Macaulay.

In 2002, Brian attended the Sundance producer's lab attached to Dopamine, which premiered in competition at the 2003 Sundance Film Festival and was awarded the Alfred P. Sloan Feature Film Prize. In early 2006, he spent 6 months in Dallas programming the country’s first large-scale permanent outdoor digital arts film festival. By the end of 2009, Brian had produced 2 more films: All About Evil, a dark comedy starring Natasha Lyonne which was purchased by NBC/Universal, and HOWL, a film about Allen Ginsberg’s controversial poem. Directed by the Academy Award winning team Rob Epstein and Jeffrey Friedman, executive produced by Gus Van Sant and starring James Franco, John Hamm and Mary-Louise Parker, HOWL opened the 2010 Sundance Film Festival.

In 2014, Brian was the First Assistant Director for the Sundance and theatrical hit The Diary of a Teenage Girl starring Kristen Wiig and Alexander Skarsgård. In 2016 with executive producer Carlos Santana, he produced Dolores, a documentary about civil rights icon Dolores Huerta with interviews by Huerta, Gloria Steinem, Angela Davis, Luis Valdez and Hillary Clinton. The film premiered in competition at the 2017 Sundance Film Festival and had a successful theatrical run in late 2017 receiving only positive reviews and attaining a 100% rating on Rotten Tomatoes. In April of 2019 Dolores won a Peabody Award and in August was nominated for an Emmy Award. At the 2018 Sundance Film Festival, he premiered Sorry To Bother You for which he served as First Assistant Director and Co-Producer. The film stars Lakeith Stanfield, Armie Hammer and Tessa Thompson and had a commercial successful theatrical run in summer 2018.

Brian has been writing and directing a short award-winning film series for the last decade and his 10th film premiered at the San Francisco International Film Festival in 2019 and is currently on a international festival tour. He is also producing 3 new feature films, writing a musical feature film which he will direct and teaching a course in Film Production and Financing at San Francisco State University.

Gus Lanza joined BenDeLaCreme Presents in 2017 as the social media manager, but quickly became more involved in the day-to-day operations: first as DeLa’s personal assistant, then as her touring stage manager, and finally becoming the company’s full-time Operations Manager.

When Gus first joined the company, BenDeLaCreme had been creating original narrative-cabaret work for the stage with well-attended, regular residencies in a handful of select cities (Seattle, New York, and Provincetown). Yet, outside of these cities, DeLa lamented, people only seemed to care about her time on Drag Race, knowing nothing of the kind of original and thought-provoking work she had been creating. Gus sought to bridge this gap with a solid PR strategy and was instrumental in vetting and assembling BenDeLaCreme’s incredible public relations team. Additionally, he, along with Kevin Heard, began streamlining the inner workings of BenDeLaCreme Presents, developing a strategy which enabled DeLa to focus solely on writing, producing, and performing her original theatrical work.

Always the visionary, Gus is credited for suggesting that DeLa and Jinkx team up for what has become their wildly successful, annual holiday show. Gus enjoys the many challenges of producing live theatre and he is so excited to be producing his first full-length film with the best team in the business.

Instagram

Twitter

Kevin Heard has been working with BenDeLaCreme for nearly a decade to help facilitate whatever brilliant endeavor she’s up to, serving as Associate Producer and Sound Designer for her four award-winning Off-Broadway premieres, her years-long run of Beware the Terror of Gaylord Manor (an annual Halloween queer-camp spooktacular at Seattle’s ACT Theatre), and several theatrical tours both domestic and international. Kevin’s work as a theatrical sound designer has been heard on Broadway, Off-Broadway, internationally, and in dozens of regional theatre productions from coast to coast. Kevin’s latest endeavor, The Heard Company, formed in early 2020, is a production company focused on creating new experiences and enabling artists and creators from all walks of life to create and share work with a broad and diverse audience. Kevin is thrilled to be working on his first film project with BenDeLaCreme and couldn’t imagine a better team to help bring this meaningful show to life.

heardaudio.com

Keith Harrison is a multi-talented creative artist with experience on hundreds of projects in the music, television, film, theatre, and live events industries. His facility, versatility, ingenuity, and positive energy have quickly made him one of the entertainment world’s most sought-after collaborators.

He has served as composer/music supervisor for the Emmy Awards, was an original Chicago cast member of the Broadway hit Million Dollar Quartet, and has collaborated with diverse and acclaimed talents such as Ariana Grande, Martin Sheen, Heather Headley, Jason Alexander, Ana Gasteyer, and Jessie Mueller. He has been musical arranger for American Idol, house pianist for Access Hollywood, and has contributed work to productions for most major Hollywood studios including Netflix, Disney, NBCUniversal, 20th Century Fox, Sony, Lifetime and more.

Keith has performed and music directed at Goodman Theatre, Center Theatre Group, The 5th Avenue Theatre, Pasadena Playhouse, Geffen Playhouse, Children’s Theatre Company and many others. He works frequently as a creative consultant and performance coach on a wide variety of theatrical endeavors, and is co-creator of the new musical Emojiland with his wife/writing partner, Laura Harrison.

Widely regarded as a “technical wizard,” Keith is adept at leveraging the latest technologies in sound and motion picture capture, digital media editing, and live production engineering. He holds a B.M. in Music Direction & Conducting and a Certificate in Musical Theatre from Northwestern University, and has taught at the American Musical and Dramatic Academy and the Theatre of Arts in Hollywood.

MAJOR SCALES is a composer, musician, writer, and performer based in Seattle who has written music for everything from award-winning cabarets, that have enjoyed extended runs in New York City and Provincetown, to amateur adult films, and campy radio plays. His original compositions have been performed on RuPaul’s Drag Race, and the new documentary, Wigstock. He created the long-touring musical comedy, The Vaudevillians, with stage partner Jinkx Monsoon, with whom he continues to regularly tour original cabaret work. Major recently toured the UK with Peaches Christ in the drag parody show, Drag Becomes Her. When the world is working, he can also be seen performing in BenDeLaCreme’s annual Halloween horror extravaganza, Beware the Terror of Gaylord Manor in Seattle. Most recently, he collaborated on a radio play with Peaches Christ, Jinkx Monsoon, and BenDeLaCreme. WQUR: Queer Quarantine Radio is available wherever podcasts are streaming.

Instagram

Twitter

Montana Tippett is a production designer for film, residing and working in Seattle. After earning her BFA at Cornish College of the Arts in Performance Production, she started her career as a scenic and costume designer in theatre. During her time working in theatre, Montana received a Seattle Times Footlight Award for her scenic design on Strawberry Theatre Workshop’s The Bells in 2012, and another Footlight Award in 2015 for her costume design on Opal Peachey’s and Mark Siano’s Bohemia. She won first place at the Kennedy Center for scenic design in 2011, and also won a Meritorious Honor Award for costume design the same year. She was twice nominated for a Gypsy Rose Lee Award for her scenic designs and had the opportunity to work at nearly every theatre in the Seattle area.

More recently, Montana has redirected herself entirely into film and splits her time between commercial and narrative work. Notable recent projects include work on Adult Swim’s Hunky Boys Go Ding Dong directed by Todd Rohal, work on the feature, Know Your Place, yet to be released by director Zia Mohajerjasbi, and work on Wes Hurley’s also soon-to-be-released feature, Potato Dreams of America. Other than to bring joy and thoughts to audiences, Montana has found a mission in her work to support historically under-represented voices whenever presented with the opportunity, a mission inspired by her many years of work at Intiman Theatre.

Hailing from Seattle, WA, Amy Enser has been editing and directing true stories and not-so-true stories for well over a decade. Passionate about storytelling, she loves challenging social norms through narratives with an irreverent lens, and has a knack for finding the heart of a story. Her debut feature documentary, The Long Haul, premiered at the 2019 Seattle International Film Festival and is currently screening around the world. Amy currently writes, directs and edits for outdoor retail company REI.

Her film credits include, The Long Haul: The Story of the Buckaroos (feature doc, directorial debut, SIFF 2019, Raindance 2019), Two Pictures (feature, Magnolia FF 2017 Best Screenplay), Gold Balls (feature doc, SIFF 2016, Newport Beach 2016, Rhode Island 2016, Heartland 2016), Dyna Does Dressage (feature doc, Mammoth Lakes Film Festival 2019), Brides to Be (feature, The Paris International Lesbian & Feminist Film Festival 2016), Manic Pixie Dream Wife (web series, Raindance 2016, ITVFest 2015), The Beast Inside (Seattle University Fellow, SIFF 2014), This is Ours (Dances With Films 2012), Welcome to Doe Bay (feature doc, Regional Emmy Nominee 2014, KCTS 2013/14, SIFF “Best of Fest” 2012), Ars Magna (short doc, National Emmy nominee 2009, PBS Documentary Spirit Award 2008).

Adam Zopfi Hulse is a PNW artist, designer and fabricator with a BFA from Cornish. Coming up in the fringe theatre landscape of Seattle as part of Annex Theatre’s creative team Adam has worked on international exhibits, built and painted sets, puppets, props and furniture from napkin sketches, taught his friends how to make water proof protest signs, and sewn everything from covid masks to doll clothes to large scale soft goods.

Adam believes that art is simultaneously about self and community as well as process and product and loves collaborating on work that reflects this. His latest work before this was a scenic design for Strawberry Theatre Workshop’s production of Timberlake Wertenbaker’s Our Country’s Good directed by Leah Adcock-Starr and his next design will hopefully be in 2021 when a new administration takes human lives seriously and has a plan to support and protect Americans.

zopfihulse.com

Instagram

Annett Mateo believes anything can be a puppet! She has made all kinds of puppets out of all kinds of materials for people, projects and theatres both nationally and internationally. In her career as a professional puppet designer and builder she has built marionettes, Muppet type puppets, rod puppets, large body/costume style, modified Banraku, shadow and pretty much every other kind of puppet. But this is her first talking eggnog! She has attended the O'Neill Theatre conference for Puppetry a number of years. She has been a member of a puppet improv group at Unexpected Productions, done theatre performances for adults and is a regular participant of regional puppet slams. You can view her work on Puppetlandia.com.

Puppetlandia.com

Instagram

Seattle's One and Only Glamazon Goddess and Queen of the Pigs, Isabella Extynn is a staple in the local Drag Scene. She produces and hosts a weekly drag brunch, Mimosas Cabaret, at the Unicorn and can be found telling stories and singing songs all over the Emerald City.

Isabella is a self taught makeup artist and wig designer and was excited to step into the role of Hair and Makeup Supervisor and Designer for the first time on a film. Follow Isabella on all of her socials and make sure to subscribe to her YouTube channel to keep up with all of her 2020 quarantine projects.

isabellaextynn.com

Instagram

Twitter

linktr.ee/IsabellaExtynn

Skilled in the craft of mixing sound, Josh Neal is a particularly awesome dude who hails from a small town in Nowhere Ohio. Josh moved from this desolate wasteland to the big city, settling in Brooklyn NY where his career began. After 7 years he decided to change up coasts and ended up in Portland, OR. Josh likes to work on movies and documentaries, and is also and artist of various mediums. He also plays some music but you'll never catch him live. The Jinkx and Dela Holiday Special was a particularly memorable and enjoyable experience for Josh, and he hopes you enjoy watching it as much as we did making it!

joshnealsound.com

Instagram

Twitter

Facebook

Mr Gorgeous has been charming audiences around the globe since 2007, with his comedic and charismatic approach to contemporary burlesque. He’s become a permanent fixture in NYC nightlife, working several iconic venues including The Slipper Room, Le Scandal, and Galapagos Art Space in addition to touring the globe with some of burlesques finest. Gorgeous has been awarded "Most Comedic" at the Burlesque Hall of Fame in 2013 and "Mr Exotic World - King of Boylesque 2014" He's also the owner and designer of "Mr Gorgeous NYC" - a unique costuming company specializing in spandex and sculptural costumes for circus, burlesque and nightlife personalities. He’s dressed some of the brightest stars in the biz ranging from the Obamas dog Bo, to Lady Gaga and the top queen’s in the drag scene.

mrgorgeousnyc.com

Instagram

Etsy

A gift of a box camera at 5 years old led Tim into a lifelong love affair with photography and darkroom printing. Later on in school, a passion for filmmaking and post production developed. These passions merged when he discovered film transfer and color grading.

Tim is one of the Pacific Northwest’s best known and most experienced colorists. Independent now, he has in the past worked for some of the largest post facilities in the NW. His advertising clients include Amazon, Walmart, Wells Fargo, and Coca Cola. His work also includes music videos for Pearl Jam, Alice in Chains, and Cypress Hill. More recently, he has focused on independent feature films and documentaries, including THE JONESES, EDEN, TOUCHY FEELY, and JOHN CARPENTER’S THE WARD.”

IMDb

Based in London, UK, Wig Chapel is the best place to get high-quality wigs and incredible custom styles. Our hair is not only for Drag Queens; whatever your creed, your gender or your ethnicity, we're here to help you get the look you want.

We offer ready-to-wear pieces as well as custom styles. Our RTW hair is sent out immediately next day, while our custom pieces are a product of collaborating with you to make the perfect hair to your exact specification.

Our custom pieces have appeared in international magazines, from Germany to Japan, as well as on stages of various theatres and operas around the UK and in several productions around the world. We can also count some of the most recognized Drag Race girls as our fabulous customers.

wigchapel.com

Instagram

Twitter
